intro: Pimelea imbricata f. piligera, commonly known as the silky pimelea, is a flowering plant native to southwestern Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, fragrant yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. This subspecies is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat.
